page.title: 20GAINFORD BONFIRE
page.content: Every{November}on the village green there is a bonfire to celebrate{Guy {Fawkes'}night. Workmen take up the grass every year from the green, then they start building a{bonfire}by placing wood and other materials in an enormous heap. During the celebrations there is a Guy Fawkes' model competition followed by a {barbecue. The bonfire is lit at 6p.m. From the barbecue people can buy{hot dogs, beef {burgers and soup.}The fireworks begin, and are lit by adult members of the village, for safety reasons. Fireworks such as{rockets, Catherine wheels, {fountains and Roman candles}light up the black sky. The bonfire rages on until late into the night. Eventually the grass is replaced and the green is restored to its original state.
